item.title: Data from: Perceived threats of infanticide reduce maternal allocation during lactation and lead to elevated oxidative damage in offspring
item.description: Sources Summary Setup Import Reproducibility Offspring weight Maternal behaviour Glucocorticoid metabolites in mothers Fig. 3 Oxidative stress in offspring Statistical Red Flags Explorations Weight gain Sources Gale T, Garratt M, Brooks RC (2018) Perceived threats of infanticide reduce maternal allocation during lactation and lead to elevated oxidative damage in offspring. Functional Ecology 32(9): 2158-2169. https://doi.org/10.1111/1365-2435.13146 Gale T, Garratt M, Brooks RC (2018) Data from: Perceived threats of infanticide reduce maternal allocation during lactation and lead to elevated oxidative damage in offspring.
